basics.name: Allison Ebsen
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: Current Undergraduate Student Pursuing a BS Degree in Computer Science | Expected to Graduate Spring 2026 | Using Tech for Positive Impact

work.company: Broad Institute of Harvard and MIT
work.summary: Working in the Beroukhim Lab associated with the Broad Institute and the Dana-Farber Cancer Institute under Postdoctoral Associate Simona Dalin
highlights: The lab focuses on developing computational approaches To interpret cancer genomes and comprehensive genomic characterization of brain cancers.

work.summary: Assists with daily operations and provides computer science consulting
highlights: Completes a variety of tasks required including: genomic work, plant tissue culture, caring for the greenhouses, R programming, and assistance with software. Currently working with convolutional neural networks and computer vision, building a model to identify coconut rhinoceros beetle in traps.
Developed a bioinformatics strategy for NIH-funded project: A Microbial Model for the Formation of Calcium Oxalate and Calcium Phosphate Stones
Learned and completed bioinformatics work including: R programming, Excel, general research, genomic assembly and annotation

volunteer.summary: PandA is a club focused on preparing students for technical interviews with challenging Leet-Code-type problems.
highlights: I attend meetings and develop problem solving abilities

volunteer.organization: Various Volunteer Activities with my Ko'a Kollective 'Ohana
volunteer.summary: We volunteer at various community organizations. So far in 2024, we've volunteered at: Ho'okua'aina and Surfrider Gardens.
highlights: Together, we build fellowship, engage with local culture, and give back to the community and land

awards.title: Purple Mai'a Build4Good Machine Learning and AI Hackathon - 1st Place
awards.summary: My team created a ML/AI based project that translates images of coral to quantitative data about that coral health. See my portfolio for more details.

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.summary: Dean's List is awarded to fulltime students who maintain a 3.5 or higher GPA.

awards.title: Worldwide Youth in Science and Engineering, Solo Gold Medal Biology at Regionals, Team 2nd Place Sectionals
awards.summary: WYSE is an academic bowl competition. In Biology solo, I placed 1st at Regionals, roughly 4th at Sectionals, and roughly 10th at State.
